授業目的: The purpose of this course is for students to use the Japanese language they usually study in the classroom in the real world, and thus not only improve their Japanese language skills but also learn about Japanese culture and society in real life through internship. Exchange students only.
到達目標: Students can deepen their understanding of Japanese business through their experiences in internships.　In addition, students can improve their Japanese language skills. This will help them to create an image of working in their home country or Japan.
授業方法:
Before registering for this course, the student must consult with the course supervisor to discuss the expectations for the internship. The supervisor will then work with the Center for International Education and Cooperation (CIEC) staff to find an appropriate placement for the student. Some possibilities for internships include companies, local government agencies, social welfare service providers, non-governmental organizations, schools, religious organizations, and so on. 
As a rule, the supervisor will serve as a liaison between the organization and the student and provide guidance when necessary. At the end of the term, the student will submit a report based on observations made during the internship, following guidelines provided by the supervisor.

トピック.授業計画1:
In this course, the host company determines the schedule of work days and hours. The internship usually takes place between the end of January and the beginning of March and lasts approximately 10 days (totaling at least 60 hours).
Students must also participate in on-campus pre-internship training and post-internship training for reflection.
